speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Come apace, good Audrey. I will fetch up

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: your goats, Audrey. And how, Audrey? Am I the

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: man yet? Doth my simple feature content you?

speaker: AUDREY
text: Your features, Lord warrant us! What

speaker: AUDREY
text: features?

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: I am here with thee and thy goats, as the

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: most capricious poet, honest Ovid, was among the

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Goths.

speaker: JAQUES
text: O knowledge ill-inhabited, worse than

speaker: JAQUES
text: Jove in a thatched house.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: When a man’s verses cannot be understood,

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: nor a man’s good wit seconded with the

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: forward child, understanding, it strikes a man more

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: dead than a great reckoning in a little room. Truly, I

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: would the gods had made thee poetical.

speaker: AUDREY
text: I do not know what “poetical” is. Is it honest

speaker: AUDREY
text: in deed and word? Is it a true thing?

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: No, truly, for the truest poetry is the most

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: feigning, and lovers are given to poetry, and what

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: they swear in poetry may be said as lovers they do

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: feign.

speaker: AUDREY
text: Do you wish, then, that the gods had made me

speaker: AUDREY
text: poetical?

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: I do, truly, for thou swear’st to me thou

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: art honest. Now if thou wert a poet, I might have

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: some hope thou didst feign.

speaker: AUDREY
text: Would you not have me honest?

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: No, truly, unless thou wert hard-favored;

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: for honesty coupled to beauty is to have honey a

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: sauce to sugar.

speaker: JAQUES
text: A material fool.

speaker: AUDREY
text: Well, I am not fair, and therefore I pray the

speaker: AUDREY
text: gods make me honest.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Truly, and to cast away honesty upon a

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: foul slut were to put good meat into an unclean

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: dish.

speaker: AUDREY
text: I am not a slut, though I thank the gods I am

speaker: AUDREY
text: foul.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Well, praised be the gods for thy foulness;

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: sluttishness may come hereafter. But be it as it may

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: be, I will marry thee; and to that end I have been

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: with Sir Oliver Martext, the vicar of the next village,

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: who hath promised to meet me in this place of the

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: forest and to couple us.

speaker: JAQUES
text: I would fain see this meeting.

speaker: AUDREY
text: Well, the gods give us joy.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Amen. A man may, if he were of a fearful

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: heart, stagger in this attempt, for here we have no

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: temple but the wood, no assembly but horn-beasts.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: But what though? Courage. As horns are odious,

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: they are necessary. It is said “Many a man knows no

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: end of his goods.” Right: many a man has good

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: horns and knows no end of them. Well, that is the

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: dowry of his wife; ’tis none of his own getting.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Horns? Even so. Poor men alone? No, no. The

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: noblest deer hath them as huge as the rascal. Is the

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: single man therefore blessed? No. As a walled town

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: is more worthier than a village, so is the forehead of

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: a married man more honorable than the bare brow

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: of a bachelor. And by how much defense is better

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: than no skill, by so much is a horn more precious

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: than to want.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Here comes Sir Oliver.—Sir Oliver Martext, you are

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: well met. Will you dispatch us here under this tree,

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: or shall we go with you to your chapel?

speaker:
OLIVER
               
              MARTEXT
text: Is there none here to give the

speaker:
OLIVER
               
              MARTEXT
text: woman?

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: I will not take her on gift of any man.

speaker:
OLIVER
               
              MARTEXT
text: Truly, she must be given, or the

speaker:
OLIVER
               
              MARTEXT
text: marriage is not lawful.

speaker: JAQUES
text: Proceed, proceed. I’ll give

speaker: JAQUES
text: her.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Good even, good Monsieur What-you-call-’t.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: How do you, sir? You are very well met. God

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: ’ild you for your last company. I am very glad to see

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: you. Even a toy in hand here, sir. Nay, pray be

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: covered.

speaker: JAQUES
text: Will you be married, motley?

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: As the ox hath his bow, sir, the horse his

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: curb, and the falcon her bells, so man hath his

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: desires; and as pigeons bill, so wedlock would be

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: nibbling.

speaker: JAQUES
text: And will you, being a man of your breeding, be

speaker: JAQUES
text: married under a bush like a beggar? Get you to

speaker: JAQUES
text: church, and have a good priest that can tell you

speaker: JAQUES
text: what marriage is. This fellow will but join you

speaker: JAQUES
text: together as they join wainscot. Then one of you will

speaker: JAQUES
text: prove a shrunk panel and, like green timber, warp,

speaker: JAQUES
text: warp.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: I am not in the mind but I were better to

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: be married of him than of another, for he is not like

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: to marry me well, and not being well married, it

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: will be a good excuse for me hereafter to leave my

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: wife.

speaker: JAQUES
text: Go thou with me, and let me counsel thee.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Come, sweet Audrey. We must be married,

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: or we must live in bawdry.—Farewell, good

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Master Oliver, not

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: But

speaker:
OLIVER
               
              MARTEXT
text: ’Tis no matter. Ne’er a fantastical

speaker:
OLIVER
               
              MARTEXT
text: knave of them all shall flout me out of my calling.
